FuncDef:
The ssh server cipher command configures encryption algorithms on an SSH server.
The undo ssh server cipher command restores the default encryption algorithms on the SSH server. The ssh server cipher command configures encryption algorithms on an SSH server. The undo ssh server cipher command restores the default encryption algorithms on the SSH server. By default:
CLIs: ssh server cipher { des_cbc | 3des_cbc | aes128_cbc | aes192_cbc | aes256_cbc | aes128_ctr | aes256_ctr | arcfour128 | arcfour256 | blowfish_cbc | aes128_gcm | aes256_gcm | aes192_ctr | sm4_cbc | sm4_gcm }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a DES encryption algorithm in CBC mode.
-

Specifies a 3DES encryption algorithm in CBC mode.
-

Specifies an AES128 encryption algorithm in CBC mode.
-

Specifies an AES192 encryption algorithm in CBC mode.
-

Specifies an AES256 encryption algorithm in CBC mode.
-

Specifies the AES128 encryption algorithm in CTR mode.
-

Specifies the AES256 encryption algorithm in CTR mode.
-

Specifies the Blowfish encryption algorithm in CBC mode.
-

Specifies an AES128 encryption algorithm in GCM mode.
-

Specifies an AES256 encryption algorithm in GCM mode.
-

Specifies the AES192 encryption algorithm in CTR mode.
-

Specifies the SM4 encryption algorithm in CBC mode.
-

Specifies a GCM SM4 encryption algorithm.
-

ExtraInfo: To configure encryption algorithms on an SSH server, run the ssh server cipher command. The SSH client and server negotiate encryption algorithms for the packets exchanged between them. During negotiation, the client sends the specified encryption algorithms to the server. After comparing the received encryption algorithms with the local ones, the server selects the first matching encryption algorithm received for packet transmission. If no matching encryption algorithm is found, the negotiation fails.
